value.title: Why User Education Is Necessary To Avoid AI Failure
value.excerpt: AI failure, in most cases, is attributed to technology-centric factors like the quality of data or the capabilities of algorithms and hardware used, ignoring the most crucial aspect of AI success—the end user.

value.title: The never-ending effort to bake common business sense into artificial intelligence
value.excerpt: There needs to be a feedback loop to ensure customers are enjoying the experience as much as you're enjoying creating the experience.'

value.title: AI Weekly: Watson Health and semi-autonomous driving failures show the dangers of overpromising AI
value.excerpt: AI technologies can fall short of their promise, as news from this week about Watson Health and semi-autonomous driving systems showed.

value.title: IBM Sells Watson Health Assets to Investment Firm
value.excerpt: The tech giant said its deal with Francisco Partners wouldn’t weaken its commitments to other artificial-intelligence technology and healthcare clients that use its IT services.

value.title: Cervical cancer patient given all-clear after revolutionary AI therapy in UK first

value.title: Microsoft will force update your PCs to Windows 10 21H2 to train its own ML Update model
value.excerpt: Microsoft has begun the forced rollout of Windows 10 21H2 update to Windows 10 20H2 devices in order to help train its Machine Learning-assisted intelligent Windows Update rollout model.

value.title: How Artificial Intelligence (AI) is Aiding Healthcare

value.title: What Learning Can Learn From Machine Learning
value.excerpt: Taking a few bits and bytes from machine learning could go a long way to improving K-12 and postsecondary learning.

value.title: Intuit CEO on the Power of Machine Learning for Small Businesses
value.excerpt: CEO Sasan Goodarzi talks about the many applications and capabilities of machine learning. Sasan Goodarzi: We apply machine learning to everything that I know about you. How many accounts payables do you have?

value.title: LaLiga employs Microsoft Azure’s AI for goal probability graphics
value.excerpt: LaLiga is using artificial intelligence and machine learning from Microsoft Azure to create new goal probability graphics on its broadcast feed from this weekend. According to LaLiga, the technology is able to calculate in 30 seconds how likely a player was to score a goal.

value.title: Artificial Intelligence: A Key Technology That's Shaping Our Tomorrow
value.excerpt: Ever since Alan Turing helped decode the Enigma messages used by the Germans during World War II, the concept of artificial intelligence started getting traction. It was only in 1956 that the term actually was officially coined by none other than John McCarthy.

value.title: New Ratings Aim To Make Partial ‘Self Driving’ Safer
value.excerpt: Many partially automated systems that “share” the driving with motorists, like Autopilot, Pilot Assist and Super Cruise, don't provide enough back-up protections, according to a new ratings system.

value.title: ANYmal’s quadrupedal robot takes a hike
value.excerpt: It’s been pretty astonishing to see what robotics researchers have been able to accomplish with legged robots over the past few years. Oregon State University taking Cassie for a 5K back in July springs to mind.

value.title: Cambrian-AI 2022 Predictions: Expect More Than Just New Chips
value.excerpt: The new year will see new chips, 2021 was another banner year for AI hardware platform innovations, as we predicted. Ok, not ALL of our prognostications came to pass, notably the stall (ok, death) of the NVIDIA/Arm deal.

value.title: Growth Alert! Robotics Rise to $70 Billion by 2028
value.excerpt: Growth = opportunity. And here’s one: robots. There are currently more than 2.7 million industrial robots and that number is growing by around 400,000 each year!

value.title: Meta researchers build an AI that learns equally well from visual, written or spoken materials
value.excerpt: Advances in the AI realm are constantly coming out, but they tend to be limited to a single domain: For instance, a cool new method for producing synthetic speech isn’t also a way to recognize expressions on human faces.

value.title: Meta's 'data2vec' is a step toward One Neural Network to Rule Them All
value.excerpt: The race is on to create one neural network that can process multiple kinds of data -- a more-general artificial intelligence that doesn't discriminate about types of data but instead can crunch them all within the same basic structure.

value.title: DeepMind co-founder leaves Google after a rocky tenure.

value.title: IRS Will Require Facial Recognition Scans to Access Your Taxes
